components.message: Deleted Purchase Order Items should be filtered out for this Analysis to disregard errors in processing. We assume that once the PO Item is deleted the variation in price of said item is no longer relevant and the error has been fixed.
Currency conversion is not yet enabled. Filtering on one currency or a set of currencies with a comperable conversion rate is necessary to achieve valid results.
Quantity unit conversion is not yet enabled. Filtering on one quantity unit is necessary to achieve valid results.
Clustering of suppliers based on the relative total order value.

formula.name: Single KPI
formula.text:
CASE 
    WHEN ISNULL(KPI("Price Variation")) = 1 OR KPI("Price Variation") = 0.0
    THEN 0.0 
    ELSE KPI("Potential Savings")
END

components.message:
Normalized Price Variation Coefficient is used to express the relative price volatility.

A data set of [100, 100, 100] has constant values. Its standard deviation is 0 and average is 100, giving the coefficient of variation as 0 / 100 = 0%

A data set of [90, 100, 110] has more variability. Its standard deviation is 10 and its average is 100, giving the coefficient of variation as 0 / 100 = 0%

A data set of [1, 5, 6, 8, 10, 40, 65, 88] has still more variability. Its standard deviation is 32.9 and its average is 27.9, giving a coefficient of variation of 32.9 / 27.9 = 118%

axis2.name: Potential Savings
axis2.text:
CASE 
    WHEN ISNULL(KPI("Price Variation")) = 1 OR KPI("Price Variation") = 0.0
    THEN 0.0 
    ELSE KPI("Potential Savings")
END

components.message:
Create Signals in the Celonis Action Engine directly from this OLAP-Table!
We recommend creating signals driectly from this OLAP.
1) Identify the supplier with the best value for price
2) Check suppliers with highly volatile prices and kick-off price negotiations

We recommend creating signals driectly from this OLAP.
1) Hedge against volatile material prices
2) Identify weak spots in supplier diversification and strengthen your bargaining power

Filters used:
1) High Runners: filter out non catalogue orders
2) Sheet: Filter our dummy value prices (for now: 0)

formula.text:
CASE
    WHEN ISNULL("LFA1"."VBUND") = 1 THEN 'External'
    ELSE 'Internal'
END

components.message:
Transfer prices (Transactions between different divisions of the same company)  are to be disregarded in this Analysis. If the trading partner is internal, this usually suggest

Default Setting: "NULL" 
This means there is no intra-company code involved.

variables.name: filter6
variables.value:
CASE
    WHEN ISNULL("LFA1"."VBUND") = 1 THEN 'External'
    ELSE 'Internal'
END

variables.name: filter7
variables.value:
CASE WHEN ISNULL("EKPO"."LOEKZ") = 1 THEN 'not deleted'
     WHEN "EKPO"."LOEKZ" = 'S' THEN 'locked'
     WHEN "EKPO"."LOEKZ" = 'L' THEN 'deleted'
     ELSE "EKPO"."LOEKZ"
END
